column4: I installed a program with "sh"  command, how do uninstall it?
what program?
well, all it did was copy files onto your system; so to undo it, you have to find an uninstall action in the script
possibly; whatever_you_ran --uninstall
: Like this "sh ioquake3-1.34-rc3.run --uninstall" ?
possibly
it looks like there may be an 'uninstall.sh' somewhere
I don't even know where to look. Should I just format the HDD drive and reinstall Ubuntu?
I just downloaded it
: Any luck?
did you run the installer with sudo?
: I used sudo -s
ok, you can run sudo /usr/local/games/ioquake3/uninstall
the installation doesn't look too invasive though; why did you want to uninstall it anyway?
Couldn't get it to work - and the installation instructions on the site are only written for experienced Linux users
Just another headache for just a simple task, I guess.
so did you try the uninstall script?
Didn't know there was one. Nothing told me one was available.
00:25 < crdlb> Guest58224: ok, you can run sudo /usr/local/games/ioquake3/uninstall
I did, and got this message Could not find a usable uninstall program. Aborting.
there should only be /usr/local/games/ioquake3/ and /usr/local/bin/ioquake3
there's no "registry" type linux thingies left behind or anything like that?
yeah nothing from an offical ubuntu package will install into /usr/local; so nothing in there is critical
How come the Linux community has the mentality that providing rudimentary information is a chore?
